results.title: The Magic sword: quest for Camelot
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Dalisa Cohen and Frederick DuChan
results.brief_description: Set in the time of King Arthur, a renegade knight sets out to seize power by stealing the sword Excalibur. Brave Hayley, who longs to become a knight, sets out together with a young blind hermit, a dragon and a falcon, to foil his plot, recover the magic sword, and save the kingdom. Featuring the voices of Cary Elwes, Gary Oldman, Eric Idle, Pierce Brosnan and Sir John Gielgud.

results.title: The Magic box
results.creator_credit: Festival Film Production, Ronald Neame and John Boulting
results.brief_description: A dramatised biography of William Friese-Greene (1855-1921), a British pioneer of the cinema. Adapted by Eric Ambler from the controversial biography by Ray Allister, the film contends that Friese-Greene was the true father of motion pictures, rather than the better known Thomas Edison. Told largely in flashback, the film details Friese-Greene’s tireless experimentation with the moving-image which mostly ended in failure and which eventually cost him his family and his reputation. The legitimacy of the claims for Friese-Greene became a central issue in the criticism of the film. Made for the 1951 Festival of Britain, ‘The Magic Box’ features Robert Donat in the lead role and a huge supporting cast including such British film luminaries as Joyce Grenfell, Miles Malleson, Michael Redgrave, Eric Portman, Emlyn Williams, Richard Attenborough, Peter Ustinov, Cecil Parker, Kay Walsh, and Laurence Olivier.

results.title: The Madness of King George
results.creator_credit: Close Call Film Production, Stephen Evans, David Parfitt, Nicholas Hytner and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Alan Bennett, “The Madness of King George” stars Nigel Hawthorne as the ailing King and Helen Mirren as his wife Queen Charlotte. King George the Third, after he lost the American colonies in the War of Independence, succumbed to intermittent bouts of madness where his usual ordered and calm persona underwent a violent and obscene transformation. The Prince of Wales becomes a willing pawn in the plot to commit the King, and establish the Regency. This is a finely acted and sumptuous production of Bennett’s play. Ian Holm plays the Doctor called in to cure the King’s madness using methods which from a modern vantage were brutal and inhumane.

results.title: The Love bug
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Walsh and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: Herbie is one of Disney’s most popular live action characters. Affectionately nicknamed ‘The Love Bug’, Herbie teams up with an unsuccessful race-car driver, Jim Douglas. Jim is amazed to find his driving improves in his new car, but realises the success is due to the car with a mind of its own when someone tries to steal Herbie. Starring Dean Jones, David Tomlinson, Michele Lee and Buddy Hackett.

results.title: The Lost weekend
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Charles Brackett and Billy Wilder
results.brief_description: This classic Hollywood drama scooped the Oscars in 1945 and it is not surprising. Ray Milland is an alcoholic writer who cannot control his binge drinking. Over a torturous weekend we see how the lure of alcohol has destroyed his confidence, his self-respect and his ambition. As it threatens to eat away at his talent, he comes closer and closer to suicidal despair. From a contemporary perspective the moralistic ending may appear trite but what is undeniable is Billy Wilder’s talent at creating a film which seems to visually simulate the terrifying perspective of a drug user’s imagination. Milland too is excellent as a man who is unable to reach the goals he sets himself. As a study of writer’s block, “The Lost Weekend” is both perceptive and illuminating. Jane Wyman appears as his long-suffering lover, however the book’s original narrative linked the writer’s fear of failure to his ambiguous sexuality. An outstanding film. Based on the book by Charles Jackson.

results.title: The Lost boys (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Harvey Bernhard and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: This popular 1987 film presents an interesting mix of genres: the 1980s teen movie with vampires. Michael and Sam are two brothers who have moved with their mother to Santa Carla, “murder capitol of the world”, unaware of the vampires residing in this fictional Californian Coastal town (the film was shot in Santa Barbara, and includes spectacular footage of the Boardwalk and beach-side amusement park). Michael is charmed by a girl named Star, and immediately falls in with a tough young gang led by David. It’s peer pressure in the extreme as Michael is tricked into drinking blood. He is turned into an unwilling vampire, and Sam looks to a pair of comic book vendors who are well versed in the dealings with vampires, to help save Michael. The insecurities and frustrations of youth are amplified and satirised by this exciting and funny MTV-generation thriller. Cast includes: Jason Patric, Corey Haim, Dianne Wiest, Kiefer Sutherland and Corey Feldman.

results.title: The Lord of the rings: the fellowship of the ring
results.creator_credit: Tim Sanders, Fran Walsh, Peter Jackson, Wingnut Films and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Iconic adaptation of J R R Tolkien’s fantasy epic, “The Lord of the rings: the fellowship of the rings” is the first instalment of the “Rings” trilogy. Director Peter Jackson (Heavenly creatures, The Frighteners, Meet the Feebles) went to incredible lengths to re-create Tolkien’s fantastical vision to the screen, by building extensive realistic sets in his native New Zealand, and by employing a slew of gifted special effects artists. In short, Frodo Baggins, a kind-hearted and earnest hobbit, is entrusted with the gallant mission to return a powerful ring from whence it came - Mount Doom, the only place where it can be destroyed. Failure to do so will result in the destruction of the earth, as the powerful ring is capable of unleashing inestimable evil. Guided by Gandalf, a powerful wizard, Frodo is accompanied on his treacherous journey by three hobbit friends, a dwarf, an elf and several humans. This heroic quest invokes all the necessary thrills of an adventure picture, whilst satiating the exacting standards of an audience inured to CGI wizardry, and gratifying legions of zealous Tolkien fans. With ambitious battle scenes and stupendous set pieces, this grand and masterful cinematic spectacle kept most viewers utterly enthralled, whilst earning Jackson almost universal praise for capturing Tolkien’s mythopoeic narrative and elegiac tone.

results.title: The Looney, looney, looney Bugs Bunny movie
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Isadore Freleng
results.brief_description: A feature length film containing some of Friz Freleng’s award winning cartoons starring those wonderful cartoon character creations of Freleng’s including Bugs Bunny, Yosemite Sam, Pepe Le Pew, Porky Pig, Daffy Duck, Tweety Pie and Sylvester. The film is presented as part of an Award Ceremony honouring the classic Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes characters beginning with Bugs Bunny in an Academy Award winning cartoon short “Knighty knight Bugs”. The program is then divided into three acts: Act I - “Satan’s waitin’” starring Yosemite Sam; Act II - “The Unmentionables” starring Bugs Bunny as Elegant Ness, co-starring Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety Pie and Sylvester along with the notorious Rocky and his gang; Act III - The Oswald Awards hosted by Bugs Bunny (a take on the Academy Awards) showing cartoon highlights of the nominees in their starring performances, including Big Bad Wolf and the Three little bops. Classic cartoons, great family entertainment. Majority of voice characterisations by Mel Blanc.

results.title: The Longest day
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F Zanuck Productions, Darryl F. Zanuck, Andrew Marton, Ken Annakin, Bernhard Wicki and Gerd Oswald
results.brief_description: Based on Cornelius Ryan’s compilation of interviews with D Day survivors, the film is broken into three sections- the Allied preparations for invasion, a faithful recreation of the movement of an Armada across the English Channel, and culminating in the attack on Normandy beaches. Intercut with these sequences is the response by German soldiers which are subtitled and directed by Bernhard Wicki. One of the most ambitious war films ever made, ‘The Longest day’ features 48 international stars, 4 directors, and won 2 Academy Awards for Special Effects and Cinematography, and was nominated for Best Picture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F Zanuck Productions, Darryl F. Zanuck, Andrew Marton, Ken Annakin, Bernhard Wicki and Gerd Oswald
